summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 8, 2019. The sheets are for monitoring inmates in continuous locked-down status, requiring irregular checks at least twice per hour. The document is significant as it provides a procedural record from the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

events.title: Routine Inmate Monitoring
events.description: Standard 30-minute checks were conducted on inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York, as per protocol for administrative detention or disciplinary segregation.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated August 8, 2019.
It details a strict monitoring protocol requiring inmates in locked-down status to be visually checked at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The sheets are for specific tiers (ZA Tier-G, H, J, K; M-TIER; L-TIER; ZB), indicating multiple segregated housing areas were under this protocol.
The logs were reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, standard procedure for correctional facility documentation.
The date (August 8, 2019) places this document two days before Jeffrey Epstein's death in the same facility on August 10, 2019.
